Chapter4 Numeric Variables
================

## 4.1 Numerical Vectors

``` r
marks <- c(10, 6, 4, 7, 8)
x <- c(1:3, 10:13)
x1 <- c(1, 2)
x2 <- c(3, 4)
x <- c(x1, x2)
x
```

    ## [1] 1 2 3 4

## 4.2 Vectors Computation

``` r
1.5 + 2.3 - 0.6 + 2.1*1.2 - 1.5/0.5 + 2^3
```

    ## [1] 10.72

``` r
## %/% integer division
## %% modulo

5 %/% 3
```

    ## [1] 1

``` r
## [1] 1
5 %% 3
```

    ## [1] 2

``` r
## [1] 2
5.1 %/% 2.5
```

    ## [1] 2

``` r
## [1] 2
5.1 %% 2.5
```

    ## [1] 0.1

``` r
## [1] 0.1
```

``` r
x <- c(1, 10)
x + 2
```

    ## [1]  3 12

``` r
## [1]  3 12
x - 2
```

    ## [1] -1  8

``` r
## [1] -1  8
x * 2
```

    ## [1]  2 20

``` r
## [1]  2 20
x / 2
```

    ## [1] 0.5 5.0

``` r
## [1] 0.5 5.0
x ^ 2
```

    ## [1]   1 100

``` r
## [1]   1 100
2 / x
```

    ## [1] 2.0 0.2

``` r
## [1] 2.0 0.2
2 ^ x
```

    ## [1]    2 1024

``` r
## [1]    2 1024
```

``` r
c(1, NA, 3) + 10
```

    ## [1] 11 NA 13

``` r
## [1] 11 NA 13
```

## 4.3 Vector Functions

``` r
x <- c(33, 55, 11)
sort(x)
```

    ## [1] 11 33 55

``` r
## [1] 11 33 55
rev(sort(x))
```

    ## [1] 55 33 11

``` r
## [1] 55 33 11
order(x)
```

    ## [1] 3 1 2

``` r
## [1] 3 1 2
x[order(x)]
```

    ## [1] 11 33 55

``` r
## [1] 11 33 55
```

``` r
cumsum(1:5)
```

    ## [1]  1  3  6 10 15

``` r
## [1]  1  3  6 10 15
cumprod(1:5)
```

    ## [1]   1   2   6  24 120

``` r
## [1]   1   2   6  24 120
```

``` r
## function seq()
seq(5)
```

    ## [1] 1 2 3 4 5

``` r
seq(2,5)
```

    ## [1] 2 3 4 5

``` r
seq(5,11,by=2)
```

    ## [1]  5  7  9 11

``` r
seq(5,11,length.out=100)
```

    ##   [1]  5.000000  5.060606  5.121212  5.181818  5.242424  5.303030  5.363636
    ##   [8]  5.424242  5.484848  5.545455  5.606061  5.666667  5.727273  5.787879

``` r
rep(c(1,3), 2)
```

    ## [1] 1 3 1 3

``` r
rep(c(1,3), c(2,4))
```

    ## [1] 1 1 3 3 3 3

``` r
rep(c(1,3), each=2)
```

    ## [1] 1 1 3 3

## 4.4 Complex Vectors

``` r
complex(real = c(1,0,-1,0), imaginary = c(0,1,0,-1))
```

    ## [1]  1+0i  0+1i -1+0i  0-1i

``` r
sqrt(-1 + 0i)
```

    ## [1] 0+1i

``` r
## [1] 0+1i
```

## 4.5 Practice

``` r
# q1
print(sqrt(1:100))
```

    ##   [1]  1.000000  1.414214  1.732051  2.000000  2.236068  2.449490  2.645751
    ##   [8]  2.828427  3.000000  3.162278  3.316625  3.464102  3.605551  3.741657

``` r
print((1:100)^(1/3))
```

``` r
#q2
x<- c(77,60,91,73,85,82,35,100,66,75)
sort(x)
```

    ##  [1]  35  60  66  73  75  77  82  85  91 100

``` r
order(x)
```

    ##  [1]  7  2  9  4 10  1  6  5  3  8

``` r
summary(x)
```

    ##    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
    ##   35.00   67.75   76.00   74.40   84.25  100.00

``` r
sd(x)
```

    ## [1] 18.07515

``` r
#q3
y<-seq(0,1,length.out=100)
y
```
